title: Large-Scale Instructional Design Workshop for Developing Decision-Making Skills in Youth Soccer Players

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary instructional methodologies and understanding of physical education curriculum content
context.additional_context: A course where pre-service teachers learn activity-based practical strategies applicable to designing actual youth soccer training programs.

learning_goals: Learners can explain activity-based practical design principles for developing decision-making skills in youth soccer training.
Learners can apply evaluation criteria distinguishing between "active decision-making" and "passive decision-making" activities with 80% accuracy.
Learners can provide specific strategies for arranging progressive decision-making activities when designing training sessions for 9-11-year-olds.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
